content: I notice that both in Drupal and in Backdrop date fields require at least gathering a year:

...so what people do when you only need to collect hrs/mins? Do you still collect the year but hide it in the form and on display? ...do you use some field-providing module instead, like https://www.drupal.org/project/hms_field or https://www.drupal.org/project/timefield or ???
The use case is schedule for regular/recurring school classes, or church mass etc.
...I realize that the same could be implemented with simple text fields, or a combo of number fields, but looking for something that handles range (start/end time like the Date module does)

...happy to see that the HMS Field module is already ported :smile: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/hms_field

backdrop-contrib/hms_field
HMS Field displays an integer formatted as Hours, Minutes or Seconds - backdrop-contrib/hms_field

It's been quite a while since I looked at recurring date code, but don't you need the date to do a recurring event? If you have something that happens every Monday at some time (for example), you still need to specify the date for this Monday, for next Monday, for the following Monday, etc. Otherwise, I think it would just happen every single day.
